summary:
Taekwondo is a popular Korean martial art and sport. It focuses on foot and hand techniques, including kicking, punching, and blocking. The name means "the way of the foot and fist." Practitioners learn patterns (poomsae), sparring (kyorugi), and breaking boards (gyeokpa). They also wear a special uniform called a dobok.

Developed in the 1940s and 50s, Taekwondo combines Korean and other martial art styles. It has been an Olympic sport since 2000. The Korea Taekwondo Association (KTA) and the International Taekwon-Do Federation (ITF) are key organizations. World Taekwondo now oversees the sport in the Olympics.
title: Taekwondo
